author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: A poignant critique of the American Dream, 'The Great Gatsby' is a timeless tale of wealth, love, and the pursuit of happiness.

author: Harper Lee
review: An evocative tale of racial injustice and moral growth, 'To Kill a Mockingbird' is as moving and relevant today as it was when first published.

author: George Orwell
review: A chilling dystopian novel, '1984' explores themes of totalitarianism, surveillance, and individuality.

author: J.K. Rowling
review: A magical start to an unforgettable series, 'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone' introduces readers to the enchanting world of Hogwarts.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: A profound exploration of teenage angst and rebellion, 'The Catcher in the Rye' is a literary classic that continues to resonate with readers.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: A captivating prelude to the Lord of the Rings, 'The Hobbit' is a masterful tale of adventure and discovery.
